Comments_List: I developed useful research and writing skills, in addition to significant knowledge about the current situation and tactics for improvement of child health and development in Africa.

Professor Alipui is super knowledgeable and a really great person. Unfortunately, he is not a great teacher. Most days were spent reading from slides or having us present group projects - an interesting time where we would receive feedback that seemed unrelated to the original guidelines he had provided. Class could be improved by making into an actual seminar or providing guidelines that would promote learnings. Readings are related, but re-capped in class.
The course workload is easily balanced with other courses, and the work is relevant. The course could be improved if assigned readings were discussed more in class.
There are so few classes on Africa that yes, just take it if you're interested, but no if you have any way to avoid it.
I would 100% recommend this course to another student. It was one of my favorite courses at Yale. I learned so much about a very interesting topic - plus, we visited the UN!
